Puklo je u Napoliju! Ančeloti i igrači digli pobunu protiv gazde
Sledi im kazna UEFA

06 Nov 2019

Bure baruta u Napulju je eksplodiralo, De Laurentisovo zatezanje konopca do maksimuma je izazvalo burnu reakciju sa druge strane.
Posle remija u četvrtom kolu Lige šampiona sa Salcburgom (1:1), trener Karlo Ančeloti se nije pojavio na konferenciji za medije iako je bio obavezan da to učini i sigurno mu sledi kazna od strane UEFA. Razlog zbog kojeg se Ančeloti odlučio na nesvakidašnji korak nema veze sa medijima kojima je trebalo da se obrati već sa unutrašnjim stvarima u klubu.
Napoli se nalazi u padu forme i već neko vreme beleži slabe rezultate. U prvenstvu je pao na sedmo mesto i pobedio je samo jednom na prethodnih pet utakmica u Seriji A. Umesto kandidata za titulu, Napoli je postao ekipa za koju niko ne bi garantovao da će se domoći jednog od prva četiri mesta i plasmana u Ligu šampiona. Takvi rezultati su razljutili kontroveznog predsednika kluba Aurelija de Laurentisa koji je prošlog vikenda posle poraza od Rome naredio celom timu odlazak u karantin iz kojeg mogu da izađu posle mečeva sa Salcburgom i Đenovom narednog vikenda. Naravno da je ekipa teško primila vest o sedmodnevnom karantinu i izolaciji od porodica, prijatelja, izalazaka...
Ančeloti se tom prilikom solidarisao sa igračima i javno se suprotstavio predsedniku rekavši da će poštovati njegovu odluku, ali da ona nije razumna i da igračima nije bio potreban karantin. Očigledno da je De Laurentisova odluka iznervirala igrače koji su posle meča odbili da daju bilo kakve izjave i pojedinačno su u automobilima napustili stadion što je iznenadilo novinare. Ekipa je trebalo da ostane u karantinu do subote i meča sa Đenovom, ali su igrači sinoć samoinicijativno napustili stadion i otišli na različite strane umesto da se zajedno u autobusu vrate u trening centar. Spekuliše se da je ekipa prvo tražila od De Laurentisa da ukine naredbu o karantinu, a kada nije dobila potvrdan odgovor, odlučila je da na svoju ruku prekine karantin i da se vrati normalnom životu. A Ančeloti ih je podržao iako se on sa stručnim štabom vratio klupskim autobusom u trening centar. 
Ostaje da se vidi kako će kapriciozni gazda De Laurentis reagovati na ovo pobunu igrača i trenera koji ih je podržao. Ančelotija može da smeni, neke igrače da kazni, ali celu ekipu ne može... Napoliju se nalazi na korak od plasmana u osminu finala Lige šampiona, ali problemu su rezultati u prvenstvu. Ako u subotu na San Paolu ne padne Đenova, očekivano je eskalaciju sukoba na relaciji De Laurentis – ekipa.
(FOTO: reuters)
text:
It's cracked in Napoli! Ancelots and players revolt against the boss
They are followed by a UEFA penalty

06 Nov 2019

A barrel of gunpowder in Naples exploded, De Laurentis' tightening of the rope to its maximum provoked a violent reaction on the other hand.
After a draw in the fourth round of the Champions League with Salzburg (1-1), coach Carlo Ancelotti did not appear at a press conference, although he was obliged to do so and was certainly followed by a penalty by UEFA. The reason why Ancelotti decided to take the extraordinary step had nothing to do with the media he had to address, but with the club's internal affairs.
Napoli is in decline and has been performing poorly for some time. He dropped to seventh in the Championship and has only won once in the last five games in Serie A. Instead of a contender for the title, Napoli has become a team that no one would guarantee to reach one of the top four places and placement in the Champions League. Such results angered controversial club president Aurelius de Laurentis, who last weekend after defeating Roma ordered the entire team to quarantine from which they could exit after the matches with Salzburg and Genoa the following weekend. Of course the team hardly received the news of the seven-day quarantine and isolation from family, friends, going out ...
Ancelotti solidified with the players and publicly opposed the president, saying that he would respect his decision but that it was not reasonable and that the players did not need quarantine. Apparently, De Laurentis's decision angered players who refused to make any statements after the match and left the stadium individually in cars, which surprised the reporters. The team was supposed to remain in quarantine until Saturday and the match with Genoa, but the players left the stadium on their own initiative last night and went to different sides instead of returning to the training center on the bus together. It is speculated that the team first asked De Laurentis to lift the quarantine order, and when she did not receive a positive answer, she decided to end the quarantine on her own and return to normal life. And Ancelotti supported them even though he and his headquarters returned with the club bus to the training center.
It remains to be seen how whimsical De Laurentis boss will react to this rebellion by the players and the coach who supported them. Ancelotia can dismiss, some players can be penalized, but the whole team can't ... Napoli is just one step away from reaching the eighth Champions League final, but the problem is the championship results. Unless Genoa falls on San Paolo on Saturday, a clash between De Laurentis and the team is expected to escalate.
(PHOTO: reuters)
